parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Weapons

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Unit Inventory

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Return the name of the currently selected weapon (on the primary turret for vehicles).

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''currentWeapon''' vehicle

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[String]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_weaponClass = [[currentWeapon]] ([[vehicle]] [[player]]);//Example: "M16A2GL"</code>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_weaponClass = [[currentWeapon]] [[player]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[currentMagazine]], [[currentMuzzle]], [[currentVisionMode]], [[currentWeaponMode]], [[currentZeroing]], [[magazinesTurret]], [[weaponsTurret]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on July 15, 2009 - 04:00 (CEST)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Lou Montana|Lou Montana]]</dt>
<dd class="note">You have to make a little delay (sleep 0.001; (not less)) to use this command, else you will be returned an empty string.
<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 15, 2009 - 04:00 (CEST)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Lou Montana|Lou Montana]]</dt>
<dd class="note">It seems it is not working in 1.02 for other unit than player.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 4, 2010</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Terox|Terox]]</dt>
<dd class="note">This works for vehicles providing there is a gunner
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
